website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for professional builders, but it might be too much for the average DIY-er.
pros: Pro-grade design with 27 compartments for a wide variety of tools
cons: Some users say its spacious design is bulky to wear

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended! I've been using these for a week now and love them! These bags are high quality and comfortable. I ordered the Medium size, I wear a 32 waist in jeans, the belt is the perfect size, allowing me enough room to wear a coat and still buckle. I looked at lots of bags, this is the nicest one I found in this price group. I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Brandee S

customer_reviews.title: Father in law loves them
customer_reviews.text: After he helped me out a lot building my tiny home, I decided to get him a new set of bags. He has been building custom homes for over 20 years and I knew that buying a guy some new bags is kind of like picking out shoes someone will like. They have to be comfortable and functional and they have to have all the right pockets so tools are easy to grab. So far he has nothing but good things to say about these bags and they still look great. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Order BIG!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 33” waist, so I ordered the medium (31”-35”) since I fell right in the middle. Can only get it closed to the first notch in the belt. And that’s wearing just a T-shirt! Don’t know what I am going to do when it gets cold and I have to wear more clothes. Order big!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what was at menards and home depot!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a much higher quality belt than you wou of get at home depot or Menards. Not quite occidental leather quality but really a good, quality framing rig. Thick fabric and heavy stitching have my confidence that this will last a few years. I've had enough big store bags to know that they aren't worth the constant replacement and sub-par performance even for the cheap price tag. Bottom line, these bags will save me money in the long run and they are laid out perfect for this full time framer!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The belt is great and the bags are really heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The belt is great and the bags are really heavy duty. I no longer have to tighten the belt to the point of loosing feeling in my legs. There are no pinch points and with the shoulder harness it will even work completely undone
customer_reviews.author: Mixed bag of nuts

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced waste
customer_reviews.text: The nail pouches are to small they always fall out, pockets all suck to be honest very uncomfortable I needed to replace the belt . I went to home Depot paid $40 for a belt that's 100% better than this one don't waste your money over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soften up
customer_reviews.text: Top of pouches is great but actual pouch could be more flexible for nails and screws hard to pack and get stuff out and walking Tri tight spaces like rebar and walls
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Roswold

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the shipping
customer_reviews.text: Love the tool belt perfect for what I need the only thing I dislike is that it was Prime eligible I'm a Prime member was supposed to get it in 2 days got it in six days not happy about that
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Allen

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a friend who does wood working. They love it. Just realize the pockets on this belt are HUGE compared to a normal belt. Definitely need the matching suspenders to hold it up.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very durable & very well made. The bottom of pockets are reinforced. The belt is very comfortable. I think I’ll have these for a very long time. You can’t see it in the picture but they do have a pocket for speed square.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bags. I have been framing for over 25 years and by far the the best and most comfortable. I ordered the medium size which fits good but if I was to do it again I would order the next size bigger. Still a great seat of bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Saillor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome belt. Light weight.. sturdy.. only had them for a few weeks but I love them.
customer_reviews.author: CharlesDeon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband said these are very nice and well made.
customer_reviews.author: cbachmeier

customer_reviews.title: USED TOOL BAG/not all items with bag
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if you sent a none used item and at least with all the stuff that’s suppose to be on the tool belt common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Cox

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had it not even a month and the Velcro started coming apart now the bags move ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stitching is very good.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made no cheap materials. Stitching is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Big spoon

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Perfect thay showed up on time look an feel great but still need to break in thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really stout belt but still lightweight. Pockets are in ...
customer_reviews.text: Really stout belt but still lightweight. Pockets are in the right places. I'll have this belt for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need help
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get the tape holder and in the picture it clearly shows it, who do I get in contact with
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I just received this belt and the first thing I noticed was the weight, or lack of it. It's light and very comfortable. For those who left reviews saying it was big and bulky, I don't think so. It's not as slim as broken in leather pouches, but it's no where near as bulky as some occidental bags either. I say it's somewhere in between. I also ordered it with the trade gear suspenders which are also comfortable and adjust perfectly. I'm very happy with this purchase because I've been searching for a comfortable setup for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Evan Stewart

product_meta.title: TradeGear MEDIUM 31-35" Carpenter’s Combo Belt & Bag – Strong & Durable Carpenter Tool Belt Designed for Optimum Comfort – Sufficient Carry Space for All Your Carpenter Tools – Partnered w/GatorBack
feature_bullets: EXPERIENCE MAXIUM COMFORT & COOLING - High Density Breathable Memory Foam Padding Air-Channel Ventilation and Contoured Back Support
SPACIOUS CARRYING CAPACITY - 2 Heavy Duty Pouches and 15 Durable Pockets Varying in Sizes to Accommodate All Your Tools and Supplies
EXCELLENT CONVENIENT DESIGN - The Easy Carry Handles Make It Easy for Transporting and Taking the Belt On and Off

ULTIMATE DURABILITY - Tool Belt Built Tough, The Reinforced Box Design With An Inner Hard Plastic Lining Is Strengthened By a Nylon Web-Core Interior, Reinforced With Bar-Tack Stitching and Heavy Duty Metal Rivets, 250 Denier DuraTek Fabric with High Density Nylon Webbing Around Pocket Openings
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED – TradeGear Guarantees Quality Of All Their Products Offering a 30-Day Money Back Guarantee Return Policy
